subject: Single FRU VPD collection
commitMessage:
Single FRU VPD collection

This commit implements a Dbus Api to collect VPD of a given FRU
by launching the parser exe asynchronously.

The caller is supposed to update Present property for that FRU
as false on Dbus before calling this Api and need to listen for
Present property change signal to mark the collection of VPD
complete for the FRU.

One of the use case for this api is to collect VPD for FRU
undergoing concurrent maintenance.

Signed-off-by: Sunny Srivastava <sunnsr25@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Idc44d6bc05deb04f3b9097ccf3129f5d2b11eaf0

Instead of adding a whole new file, pleae modify the existing example JSON.
This method uses a bool return to indicate both a "no pre-action needed" and an error. Please fix.

As in ibm_vpd_app, where this function was defined before. It was just returning incase preAction flag is missing or there is any error and would not proceed with bind and postFailAction.

I am just trying to replicate that by returning false from here indicates we do not need to execute bind and postFailAction. In case of error we have additional log there.
executePost?
An indication of error will be good, as in below?
This is not an error.

This is an unintended side-effect of moving the GPIO function to the util file. The tool does not even use these. We should split the utils into common and app utils. Please add a TODO here  to do that in a future commit.
Won't this be costly, than checking using file operators?
I did not get that. Could you please give some detail.
If the preaction part fails, we should not be doing this at all, right?
I thought we discussed that though it is only for cable cards right now we will keep it generic. Hence for FRUs for which preAction is not applicable we will just collect the VPD.

please change this to devAddress, to sync with json and other files.
Line 257 also
Can it/name be changed for Single FRUVPD?

This is the name coming from interface file. Changing here will lead to change there. Ac costly deal. 😊
Lets see if there is majority who thinks we need to change than we can take a call.
Or new_device/delete_device.

Just a suggestion-
we can have this flag as "CMable"

Also, we can omit this flag and check if item is PCIe_card

Lets keep the code as generic as possible and when it is Json driven then Json should have the info if a FRU is CMable. Just like Json has info about system fru via a flag.

If the Json change is not in yet, We can modify the flag name.
You have segregated pre-Action code(GPIO setup + binding) and executing only GPIO setting here. Is that the requirement?

bool prePostActionRequired = executePreAction
i think this will tell you -
1. if preAction flag set for this FRU?
2. If set , then take action on it. is successfull OR Not?

so we can name it something relevant like- 
  bool isPreActionDone = executePreAction
Binding is taken care below. The execution part has been shifted to a new api though.
The flag is more of to check if I need post action or not.

don't you think // unbind, bind the driver to trigger parser. should be based on the result of
executePreAction(jsonFile, vpdFilePath);

I did not get your point here. 
If you mean to say we should only triggerVpdCollection if executePreAction passes then we will be limiting this api to frus which has preaction defined in Json.
BTW the code should be modified to not bind/unbind for frus which has preaction defined and it fails.
execute?
Done

as of now, for all PCIe  we have same data in
"concurrentMantainable" = true,
"driverType" = at24,
"busType" = i2c
Why can't we take it as default if it is PCIe_cards ? This is making json file bigger with non-unique data.

As discussed, we will take this change later. Also this is getting called both in case of CM and also from collection of VPD at standby. So hardcoding just for PCIe might not make sense.

driverType and busType can be extracted from path but "concurrentMantainable" falg i would still like to keep in Json so that Json can give the info which FRUs are CMable. 
Just like we have isSystem flag in Json.
you can remove this line. as you already have hardcoded strings in 273, 278.
It was here as it was being used in bth if and else part line 273-278 and 297. But now since else is also getting modified. I can remove it.
this "bind" is modified as "devAddress" in json, for appropriate name.
That change is in? Last time when I tested it was bind.
Will do the change once we update out json.
Will update once we come up with the Json changes.
Ack

Don't you think should return after error log, if not found?

it will fail in 205
